Certificate of Higher Education in Supporting Learning (HLTA Route)
A year long programme of 6 modules drawn from the Foundation Degree in Supporting Learning, including HLTA Preparation and Assessment and in total comprising Level 1 of the FDSL programme.
• Literacy and Numeracy qualifications at Level 2, i.e. Basic Skills Level 2 or G.C.S.E. Grades A-C (C.S.E. Grade 1)
• Evidence of Level 3 study or pass a written essay paper marked at Level 3
N.B A support statement from school will be required and schools are asked to provide a mentor.
3 days attendance at Pre Programme Preparation, prior to the course,  providing
a framework for key skills and study skills and setting up a personal development plan.
6 modules attracting 20 HE credits each, drawn from the following:

Delivery: Weekly 6-hour sessions during school term dates. Candidates will be expected to carry out weekly school-based tasks culminating in submission of a written assignment for each 6-week module. Schools are asked to support the candidates in carrying out the work-based tasks, and to provide a mentor who can provide pastoral and practical support. Assessment for HLTA status carried out on completion of academic year. Candidates are normally notified 6-8 weeks later. Total time involved: 4 school terms.
Achievement: 120 HE credits, Certificate of Higher Education on completing the year, preparation and submission for HLTA status.
Funding: It is recommended that you contact your Local Authority to determine funding availability and also approach the Support Staff manager in school with regard to potential school funding .
